cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 295 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, then forecast to cross Georgia/South Carolina and move up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach (near Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Suwannee River and west of Mexico Beach to Destin
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Suwannee River to Mexico Beach; Tropical Storm Warning: Anclote River to Suwannee River and west of Mexico Beach to Destin
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend, then the coasts of GA/SC/NC
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but not likely (forecast 1–3 ft in Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt, gusts to 50 kt) possible Thursday afternoon through early Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, around Thursday night high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of heavy rain with localized higher totals, potential for flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Thursday into Thursday night
